newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Lindt sees 1996 trend continuing in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Lindt sees 1996 trend continuing in 1997.

text.p: Lindt & Spruengli expects last year's progress to be matched in 1997, chief executive Ernst Tanner said.

"The trend in the first quarter of financial 1997 seems to confirm our expectation that we can match last year's progress," Tanner said according to the text of a speech released before a news conference.
Tanner said that several markets had begun to show signs of "a slight economic rebound" this year.
"The improved baseline condition should have a positive impact on consumer behaviour," he added.

Tanner said Lindt & Spruengli Germany and Lindt & Spruengli Switzerland were not able to match 1995 sales figures last year but its France operations posted an "encouraging increase" of six percent in turnover.
Sales at Lindt & Spruengli Italy grew 12 percent, he said.
In order of sales, the company's main markets are Germany, France, Switzerland and Italy, accounting for approximately 80 percent of consolidated sales.
